Token.Abstract: AFHTTPClient captures the common patterns of communicating with an web application over HTTP. It encapsulates information like base URL, authorization credentials, and HTTP headers, and uses them to construct and manage the execution of HTTP request operations.
The url used as the base for paths specified in methods such as getPath:parameters:success:failure
The url used as the base for paths specified in methods such as getPath:parameters:success:failure
The string encoding used in constructing url requests. This is NSUTF8StringEncoding by default.
The string encoding used in constructing url requests. This is NSUTF8StringEncoding by default.
The AFHTTPClientParameterEncoding value corresponding to how parameters are encoded into a request body. This is AFFormURLParameterEncoding by default.
The AFHTTPClientParameterEncoding value corresponding to how parameters are encoded into a request body. This is AFFormURLParameterEncoding by default.
The operation queue which manages operations enqueued by the HTTP client.
The operation queue which manages operations enqueued by the HTTP client.
The reachability status from the device to the current baseURL of the AFHTTPClient.
The reachability status from the device to the current baseURL of the AFHTTPClient.
Default SSL pinning mode for each AFHTTPRequestOperation created by HTTPRequestOperationWithRequest:success:failure:.
Default SSL pinning mode for each AFHTTPRequestOperation created by HTTPRequestOperationWithRequest:success:failure:.
Whether each AFHTTPRequestOperation created by HTTPRequestOperationWithRequest:success:failure: should accept an invalid SSL certificate.
Whether each AFHTTPRequestOperation created by HTTPRequestOperationWithRequest:success:failure: should accept an invalid SSL certificate.
Creates and initializes an AFHTTPClient object with the specified base URL.

Parameter.Name: url
Parameter.Abstract: The base URL for the HTTP client. This argument must not be nil.

Token.Abstract: Initializes an AFHTTPClient object with the specified base URL.

Parameter.Name: url
Parameter.Abstract: The base URL for the HTTP client. This argument must not be nil.

Token.Abstract: Sets a callback to be executed when the network availability of the baseURL host changes.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: A block object to be executed when the network availability of the baseURL host changes.. This block has no return value and takes a single argument which represents the various reachability states from the device to the baseURL.

Token.Abstract: Attempts to register a subclass of AFHTTPRequestOperation, adding it to a chain to automatically generate request operations from a URL request.

Parameter.Name: operationClass
Parameter.Abstract: The subclass of AFHTTPRequestOperation to register

ReturnValue.Abstract: YES if the registration is successful, NO otherwise. The only failure condition is if operationClass is not a subclass of AFHTTPRequestOperation.

Token.Abstract: Unregisters the specified subclass of AFHTTPRequestOperation from the chain of classes consulted when -requestWithMethod:path:parameters is called.

Parameter.Name: operationClass
Parameter.Abstract: The subclass of AFHTTPRequestOperation to register

Token.Abstract: Returns the value for the HTTP headers set in request objects created by the HTTP client.

Parameter.Name: header
Parameter.Abstract: The HTTP header to return the default value for

ReturnValue.Abstract: The default value for the HTTP header, or nil if unspecified

Token.Abstract: Sets the value for the HTTP headers set in request objects made by the HTTP client. If nil, removes the existing value for that header.

Parameter.Name: header
Parameter.Abstract: The HTTP header to set a default value for

Parameter.Name: value
Parameter.Abstract: The value set as default for the specified header, or `nil

Token.Abstract: Sets the "Authorization" HTTP header set in request objects made by the HTTP client to a basic authentication value with Base64-encoded username and password. This overwrites any existing value for this header.

Parameter.Name: username
Parameter.Abstract: The HTTP basic auth username

Parameter.Name: password
Parameter.Abstract: The HTTP basic auth password

Token.Abstract: Sets the "Authorization" HTTP header set in request objects made by the HTTP client to a token-based authentication value, such as an OAuth access token. This overwrites any existing value for this header.

Parameter.Name: token
Parameter.Abstract: The authentication token

Token.Abstract: Clears any existing value for the "Authorization" HTTP header.
Set the default URL credential to be set for request operations.

Parameter.Name: credential
Parameter.Abstract: The URL credential

Token.Abstract: Creates an NSMutableURLRequest object with the specified HTTP method and path.

Parameter.Name: method
Parameter.Abstract: The HTTP method for the request, such as GET, POST, PUT, or DELETE. This parameter must not be nil.

Parameter.Name: path
Parameter.Abstract: The path to be appended to the HTTP client's base URL and used as the request URL. If nil, no path will be appended to the base URL.

Parameter.Name: parameters
Parameter.Abstract: The parameters to be either set as a query string for GET requests, or the request HTTP body.

Token.Abstract: Creates an NSMutableURLRequest object with the specified HTTP method and path, and constructs a multipart/form-data HTTP body, using the specified parameters and multipart form data block. See http://www.w3.org/TR/html4/interact/forms.html#h-17.13.4.2

Parameter.Name: method
Parameter.Abstract: The HTTP method for the request. This parameter must not be GET or HEAD, or nil.

Parameter.Name: path
Parameter.Abstract: The path to be appended to the HTTP client's base URL and used as the request URL.

Parameter.Name: parameters
Parameter.Abstract: The parameters to be encoded and set in the request HTTP body.

Parameter.Name: block
Parameter.Abstract: A block that takes a single argument and appends data to the HTTP body. The block argument is an object adopting the AFMultipartFormData protocol. This can be used to upload files, encode HTTP body as JSON or XML, or specify multiple values for the same parameter, as one might for array values.

Token.Abstract: Creates an AFHTTPRequestOperation.
Token.Declaration: - (AFHTTPRequestOperation *)HTTPRequestOperationWithRequest:(NSURLRequest *)urlRequest success:(void ( ^ ) ( AFHTTPRequestOperation *operation , id responseObject ))success failure:(void ( ^ ) ( AFHTTPRequestOperation *operation , NSError *error ))failure

Parameter.Name: urlRequest
Parameter.Abstract: The request object to be loaded asynchronously during execution of the operation.

Parameter.Name: success
Parameter.Abstract: A block object to be executed when the request operation finishes successfully. This block has no return value and takes two arguments: the created request operation and the object created from the response data of request.

Parameter.Name: failure
Parameter.Abstract: A block object to be executed when the request operation finishes unsuccessfully, or that finishes successfully, but encountered an error while parsing the response data. This block has no return value and takes two arguments:, the created request operation and the NSError object describing the network or parsing error that occurred.

Token.Abstract: Enqueues an AFHTTPRequestOperation to the HTTP client's operation queue.

Parameter.Name: operation
Parameter.Abstract: The HTTP request operation to be enqueued.

Token.Abstract: Cancels all operations in the HTTP client's operation queue whose URLs match the specified HTTP method and path.

Parameter.Name: method
Parameter.Abstract: The HTTP method to match for the cancelled requests, such as GET, POST, PUT, or DELETE. If nil, all request operations with URLs matching the path will be cancelled.

Parameter.Name: path
Parameter.Abstract: The path appended to the HTTP client base URL to match against the cancelled requests. If nil, no path will be appended to the base URL.

Token.Abstract: Creates and enqueues an AFHTTPRequestOperation to the HTTP client's operation queue for each specified request object into a batch. When each request operation finishes, the specified progress block is executed, until all of the request operations have finished, at which point the completion block also executes.
Token.Declaration: - (void)enqueueBatchOfHTTPRequestOperationsWithRequests:(NSArray *)urlRequests progressBlock:(void ( ^ ) ( NSUInteger numberOfFinishedOperations , NSUInteger totalNumberOfOperations ))progressBlock completionBlock:(void ( ^ ) ( NSArray *operations ))completionBlock

Parameter.Name: urlRequests
Parameter.Abstract: The NSURLRequest objects used to create and enqueue operations.

Parameter.Name: progressBlock
Parameter.Abstract: A block object to be executed upon the completion of each request operation in the batch. This block has no return value and takes two arguments: the number of operations that have already finished execution, and the total number of operations.

Parameter.Name: completionBlock
Parameter.Abstract: A block object to be executed upon the completion of all of the request operations in the batch. This block has no return value and takes a single argument: the batched request operations.

Token.Abstract: Enqueues the specified request operations into a batch. When each request operation finishes, the specified progress block is executed, until all of the request operations have finished, at which point the completion block also executes.
Token.Declaration: - (void)enqueueBatchOfHTTPRequestOperations:(NSArray *)operations progressBlock:(void ( ^ ) ( NSUInteger numberOfFinishedOperations , NSUInteger totalNumberOfOperations ))progressBlock completionBlock:(void ( ^ ) ( NSArray *operations ))completionBlock

Parameter.Name: operations
Parameter.Abstract: The request operations used to be batched and enqueued.

Parameter.Name: progressBlock
Parameter.Abstract: A block object to be executed upon the completion of each request operation in the batch. This block has no return value and takes two arguments: the number of operations that have already finished execution, and the total number of operations.

Parameter.Name: completionBlock
Parameter.Abstract: A block object to be executed upon the completion of all of the request operations in the batch. This block has no return value and takes a single argument: the batched request operations.

Token.Abstract: Creates an AFHTTPRequestOperation with a GET request, and enqueues it to the HTTP client's operation queue.
Token.Declaration: - (void)getPath:(NSString *)path parameters:(NSDictionary *)parameters success:(void ( ^ ) ( AFHTTPRequestOperation *operation , id responseObject ))success failure:(void ( ^ ) ( AFHTTPRequestOperation *operation , NSError *error ))failure

Parameter.Name: path
Parameter.Abstract: The path to be appended to the HTTP client's base URL and used as the request URL.

Parameter.Name: parameters
Parameter.Abstract: The parameters to be encoded and appended as the query string for the request URL.

Parameter.Name: success
Parameter.Abstract: A block object to be executed when the request operation finishes successfully. This block has no return value and takes two arguments: the created request operation and the object created from the response data of request.

Parameter.Name: failure
Parameter.Abstract: A block object to be executed when the request operation finishes unsuccessfully, or that finishes successfully, but encountered an error while parsing the response data. This block has no return value and takes two arguments:, the created request operation and the NSError object describing the network or parsing error that occurred.

Token.Abstract: Creates an AFHTTPRequestOperation with a POST request, and enqueues it to the HTTP client's operation queue.
Token.Declaration: - (void)postPath:(NSString *)path parameters:(NSDictionary *)parameters success:(void ( ^ ) ( AFHTTPRequestOperation *operation , id responseObject ))success failure:(void ( ^ ) ( AFHTTPRequestOperation *operation , NSError *error ))failure

Parameter.Name: path
Parameter.Abstract: The path to be appended to the HTTP client's base URL and used as the request URL.

Parameter.Name: parameters
Parameter.Abstract: The parameters to be encoded and set in the request HTTP body.

Parameter.Name: success
Parameter.Abstract: A block object to be executed when the request operation finishes successfully. This block has no return value and takes two arguments: the created request operation and the object created from the response data of request.

Parameter.Name: failure
Parameter.Abstract: A block object to be executed when the request operation finishes unsuccessfully, or that finishes successfully, but encountered an error while parsing the response data. This block has no return value and takes two arguments:, the created request operation and the NSError object describing the network or parsing error that occurred.

Token.Abstract: Creates an AFHTTPRequestOperation with a PUT request, and enqueues it to the HTTP client's operation queue.
Token.Declaration: - (void)putPath:(NSString *)path parameters:(NSDictionary *)parameters success:(void ( ^ ) ( AFHTTPRequestOperation *operation , id responseObject ))success failure:(void ( ^ ) ( AFHTTPRequestOperation *operation , NSError *error ))failure

Parameter.Name: path
Parameter.Abstract: The path to be appended to the HTTP client's base URL and used as the request URL.

Parameter.Name: parameters
Parameter.Abstract: The parameters to be encoded and set in the request HTTP body.

Parameter.Name: success
Parameter.Abstract: A block object to be executed when the request operation finishes successfully. This block has no return value and takes two arguments: the created request operation and the object created from the response data of request.

Parameter.Name: failure
Parameter.Abstract: A block object to be executed when the request operation finishes unsuccessfully, or that finishes successfully, but encountered an error while parsing the response data. This block has no return value and takes two arguments:, the created request operation and the NSError object describing the network or parsing error that occurred.

Token.Abstract: Creates an AFHTTPRequestOperation with a DELETE request, and enqueues it to the HTTP client's operation queue.
Token.Declaration: - (void)deletePath:(NSString *)path parameters:(NSDictionary *)parameters success:(void ( ^ ) ( AFHTTPRequestOperation *operation , id responseObject ))success failure:(void ( ^ ) ( AFHTTPRequestOperation *operation , NSError *error ))failure

Parameter.Name: path
Parameter.Abstract: The path to be appended to the HTTP client's base URL and used as the request URL.

Parameter.Name: parameters
Parameter.Abstract: The parameters to be encoded and appended as the query string for the request URL.

Parameter.Name: success
Parameter.Abstract: A block object to be executed when the request operation finishes successfully. This block has no return value and takes two arguments: the created request operation and the object created from the response data of request.

Parameter.Abstract: A block object to be executed when the request operation finishes unsuccessfully, or that finishes successfully, but encountered an error while parsing the response data. Token.Abstract: Creates an AFHTTPRequestOperation with a PATCH request, and enqueues it to the HTTP client's operation queue.
Token.Declaration: - (void)patchPath:(NSString *)path parameters:(NSDictionary *)parameters success:(void ( ^ ) ( AFHTTPRequestOperation *operation , id responseObject ))success failure:(void ( ^ ) ( AFHTTPRequestOperation *operation , NSError *error ))failure

Parameter.Abstract: The path to be appended to the HTTP client's base URL and used as the request URL.
